result.execSummary:
The defendant Blair K LaRose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**CORRECTED 12-19-2014:  Defendant is not eligible for the Earned Release Program or Challenge Program until 8 years of sentence have been served.**
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week, until employed full time and then 3 per week, and provide signed proof of attendance.  No contact with the co-defendant (person, property, residence or family) until agent agrees.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Blair K LaRose in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Blair K LaRose in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.  Transcript filed:  March 20,2015/lkh.
Plea - Cts. 1 - G, 2 - NC, 3 - NC, 4 - G.
BTC:  Cts. 1,2,3,4 - GUILTY.  Cts. 5,6,7,8 - DRI.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Blair K LaRose in court with attorney Donald L Conner.  Defendant Blair K LaRose in custody.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.   Transcript filed: 3-12-2015 ds. Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant AF.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Blair K LaRose in court with attorney Michelle M Anderson.  Defendant Blair K LaRose in custody.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.   Transcript filed:  3-12-2015 ds. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
